page.title: 13Cuxton Marina
page.content: Cuxton Marina opened in 1983. It has space for 160 boats. It costs Â£22 per foot per year. So if you had a boat ten feet long it would cost Â£220. The pontoon is 1,000 metres long. Everything that is attached to the pontoon floats with the tide. The pontoon moves up and down 4 metres between tides. The piles are 12 metres deep and keep the pontoon from floating away. As well as selling boats, the Marina sells spare parts. You can buy a boat called the Sea Warrior 27 for Â£25,000. There are 2 ways of mooring a boat. The first is trot mooring, using buoys. The second is along the pontoon. There are often collisions because a boat is much harder to steer than a car as a boat moves sideways.
